summary: This is an email chain from April 3, 2020, where attorney Sarah Coyne informs recipients she is filing a sealed motion to reduce a client's sentence, citing the client's attempted cooperation with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. She attaches a portion of the motion detailing the client's assistance and seeks feedback to avoid misrepresentation.

persons.name: Sarah Coyne
persons.context: Attorney filing a motion to have a client's sentence reduced, citing the client's attempted cooperation with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the SDNY investigation into the events surrounding his death; the client attempted to cooperate with this investigation.

connections.description: Sarah Coyne is the attorney filing a motion for sentence reduction on behalf of her client.
The client attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Motion Filing Discussion
events.description: Attorney Sarah Coyne communicates her intent to file a sealed motion for her client's sentence reduction, based on the client's attempted cooperation with the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death Investigation
events.description: The SDNY is conducting an investigation into the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: An attorney is preparing a sealed motion for a client's sentence reduction based on the client's attempted cooperation with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The attorney seeks to coordinate with prosecutors to accurately characterize the client's assistance and potentially have them advise the court on it.
The email indicates ongoing legal proceedings and investigations related to Epstein's death as of April 2020.
The identity of the cooperating client is redacted or not fully disclosed in this excerpt.
